abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Electricity Generation
            Rehabilitation and Restructuring Project for Turkey were as
            follows: the Bank performance was satisfactory, the Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory, and all other ratings are
            not applicable since the operation is cancelled.
            Rehabilitation of large power plants is highly complex and
            risky, and it is difficult to attract interested qualified
            bidders. To meet the requirement for functional guarantees
            for plant performance, a contractor faces technical and
            financing challenges, as well as other factors that are out
            of the control of the contractor, such as fuel quality.
            Qualified bidders may not want to take the risks on
            functional guarantees and to bear on high financial
            commitments. Perhaps the prudent solution for such
            investments is through private participation, where the
            private investor is given the mandate of rehabilitating the
            plant as well as operating it thereafter. This approach may
            reduce risk perceptions, and also provide sufficient
            incentives to the private sector to undertake such
            investments. A strong and well-staffed implementing agency
            equipped with suitable decision making authority is
            necessary for such a large and complex project to be
            implemented successfully. In addition, it would be useful to
            consider hiring the services of a qualified and experienced
            firm to assist the implementing agency in project management
            and supervision, starting with preparation of tender
            documents, managing the procurement process, and eventually
            assisting in implementation.
